result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred judgment agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed. The defendant has not been convicted of the dismissed charges.

The defendant Lindsey R Collins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars.

The defendant may not possess, purchase or consume any pseudoephedrine unless it is with a doctor's prescription.

The defendant must notify the Court and DA within 48 hours of any new address or phone number.

The defendant must notify the DA within 48 hours of any new charges.

The defendant must comply with all the terms and conditions of the attached DEJ.

The defendant must cooperate in the prosecution of David Tallier and Shandon Tallier as it relates to the actions in this case (Court extensively described cooperation).

The defendant must comply with the conditions for return and supervision of her children under the current CHIPS order.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Allow release from custody for the purposes of inpatient treatment at Koinonia or similar facility - must be transported by family to facility and transported back upon completion of inpatient treatment - must comply with all recommended treatment plans and rules of the facility.

Defendant Lindsey R Collins in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:22 PM. State - resolved. Court has Amended Information. State - added DC count to Information thus filing Amended Informatipon - plead G/NC to count #1 of amended information with joint recommendation of a deferred entry of judgment for 1 year, plead G/NC to count #2 as added and withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year, concurrent to DEJ on count #1, and follow provisions on the Deferred Entry of Judgment (DEJ) - provide truthful testimony against David and Shandon Tallier, 50 hours of community service, complete probation with its conditions, comply with terms of bond, notify DA office in writing of any change of address/phone number, notify DA offices of any new crimes charged with, AODA and follow thru, no possession, purchase or consume psyedphridine, state would then move to dismiss count #1 with prejudice of complied with. Joy and Lindsey agree. Lindsey pleads G to count #1 as alleged and count #2 as alleged and added. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to jury. Court accepts plea on count #2 and defers finding of guilt on count #1 and will accept the DEJ that has been filed with the Court, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Collins withholds statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: accepts DEJ for one year on count #1 and on count #2 - withholds sentence and place on probation for 1 year, concurrent to DEJ, with conditions of: costs - take bond posted and remainder stays on case until DEJ is completed, AODA and follow thru, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 50 hours of community service, bond still continues but set at $1557.00 with same conditions, notify Court and DA within 48 hours of any new address or phone number, notify DA within 48 hours of any new charges, may not possess, purcharse or consume any psudophedrine unless it is with a doctor's prescription, comply with terms and conditions of the DEJ, cooperate in the prosecution of David and Shandon Tallier that relates to the actions in this case - describes cooperation, comply with the conditions for return and supervision of her children under the current CHIPS order, credit for ? days only if revoked, right to appeal, adjourned.
$1000 bond refund - clerk resent to correct address

Allow release from custody for the purposes of inpatient treatment at Koinonia or similar facility - must be transported by family to facility and transported back upon completion of inpatient treatment - must comply with all recommended treatment plans and rules of the facility.
Final pre-trial on February 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Called at 11:04 AM. Lindsey Collins appears in person and with counsel Jeff Joy. State appears by Charles Simono. State - special prosecutor notice has been submitted for Jodie Bednar-Clemens to handle this case but Simono will handle the ARGN today. Joy has Information, waives reading, enters NG plea. Court continues bond, accepts plea, set for FPT on 2/25/15 at 1:30 PM. Joy - bond - asks for reduction in bond to $2000 cash for stated reasons. State has no objections. Court - reduces bond to $2,000.00 cash with same conditions and refund remainder to poster.

Called at 2:53 PM. Lindsey Collins appears in person and with counsel Jeff Joy. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. Joy provides court with waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors complaint. Joy has Information, requests ARGN. Court continues bond, set for ARGN on 1/7/15 at 10:30 AM.
and certificate of appearance Deputy TR

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on December 11, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Called at 10:25 AM. Lindsey Collins appears in person and with counsel Jeff Joy. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. Joy and Collins have complaint, waives reading, requests PH but waives time limits for it. Court continues bond, considers time limits waived, set for PH on 12/11/14 at 2:30 PM, will be waiver of PH. Joy wants to be heard on bond - would like reduced to $3000 cash bond for stated reasons. State has no objections to a reduction in bond. Court - bond - $3000 cash bond with same conditions, refund $1000 to poster.

Allow release from custody for the purposes of inpatient treatment at Koinonia or similar facility - must be transported by family to facility and transported back upon completion of inpatient treatment - must comply with all recommended treatment plans and rules of the facility.
